etymologies: late Middle English. From (i) Middle Dutch āme kind of liquid measure (Dutch aam, also denoting a tun holding this quantity)

definitions: Originally: a liquid measure used in Germany and the Low Countries which varied in different places from about 30 to 44 imperial gallons (136 to 200 litres). In later use also: a liquid measure used in South Africa, typically 30 to 34 gallons (136 to 154 litres).
